page.title: 02Kingston Hill Farm
page.content: The farm is situated a mile outside Kingston Baguize.The farmer,Mr. Christenson,rents his land from St. John's College.The land is made up of wet clay to the north by the river and dry sandy soil to the south There are three main crops-560acres of grass,70acres of maize and 70acres of wheat.The grass is used for grazing and silage,the maize is used for winter fodder and the wheat is sent away to make biscuits. It is basically a dairy farm.380 friesan cows are milked twice a day to produce 7000litres of milk.The cattle eat grass,maize,silage and pellets in the winter.He has two big bulls-an Angus and a Hereford. The farm buildings include a milking parlour,cow kennels,where cattle stay in winter and 4 large covered barns. The farmhouse dates from Queen Anne.
